protein.specific_function: Involved in bile acid synthesis and is responsible for the conversion of 7 alpha-hydroxy-4-cholesten-3-one into 7 alpha, 12 alpha-dihydroxy-4-cholesten-3-one. Responsible for the balance between formation of cholic acid and chenodeoxycholic acid. Has a rather broad substrate specificity including a number of 7-alpha-hydroxylated C27 steroids.

reference.reference_text: Gafvels M, Olin M, Chowdhary BP, Raudsepp T, Andersson U, Persson B, Jansson M, Bjorkhem I, Eggertsen G: Structure and chromosomal assignment of the sterol 12alpha-hydroxylase gene (CYP8B1) in human and mouse: eukaryotic cytochrome P-450 gene devoid of introns. Genomics. 1999 Mar 1;56(2):184-96.
